content: smällkaramell socks pattern by princessknitss inspired by swedish christmas crackers these socks will keep you stylish and warm during the holidays the socks are worked seamlessly from the toe up with a repeating cable motif featuring a short-row heel and finishing with 1x1 ribbing needles & tools gauge 2 5mm circular needles 30 sts x 42 row in stockinette on 10x10 tapestry needle for weaving in ends cm after blocking cable needle or spare dpn size yarn finished circumference is 19 cm 100g järbo mellanraggi 100g = 260m or recommended negative ease is 0-2 cm any sock yarn of your choice length of sock is 25 cm but is easily adjustable techniques judys magic cast on abbreviations m1r increase k - knit m1l increase p - purl left leaning cables co - cast on german short row sts - stitches italian bind off n1 - needle one n2 - needle two m1r - right leaning increase m1l - left leaning increase 2/2 lc - place 2 sts on cable needle in front of work k2 then k the sts from the cable needle #smällkaramellsocks by @princessknitss notes - this pattern has not been tech edited or test knitted if you encounter any mistakes or need help with the pattern please email me at princessknitss@gmail com or message me on instagram @princessknitss - the pattern is written for magic loop and refers to it as needle one and needle two you can use dpns or any other method of choice but you will need to place a marker to indicate the beginning of each round - this pattern includes only one size but the length of the sock is made to measure the cable motifs are in repeats of 6 stitches so you can add or remove repeats to customize the circumference of the sock to get your desired fit - i chose to do an anatomical toe on my socks following this pattern but you can use any toe construction you want as long as you get the correct amount of stitches indicated in the pattern this pattern gives instructions for a standard symmetrical toe #smällkaramellsocks by @princessknitss pattern toe using the judy s magic cast on and 2 5mm circular needles co 20 sts 10 on each needle r1 k all sts r2 k1 m1l k until the last st of n1 m1r k1 k1 m1l k until the last st of n2 m1r k1 repeat until you have 60sts 30 on each needle foot n1 knit according to chart n2 k all sts repeat until the sock measures 5 cm less than your total foot length it does not matter which row of the chart you end on but make a note of your position so you can continue knitting the chart correctly after completing the heel heel knit across needle 1 according to the chart you will now work short row to shape the heel on needle 2 all turns are made using the german short row
